  • Method Details

    • available

      public int available()

    • refillByteBuffer

      protected boolean refillByteBuffer() throws IOException
      Refills the byteBuffer by reading characters from the character supplier, encoding them, and storing the resulting bytes into the byteBuffer.
      Returns:
      true if the buffer was successfully refilled and has bytes available for reading, false if the end of the stream is reached and there are no more bytes to read.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • encodeChars

      protected void encodeChars(CharBuffer in, boolean isEndOfInput) throws CharacterCodingException
      This method is called by refillByteBuffer() to encode characters from the given CharBuffer into bytes and stores them in the byteBuffer.

      The method can be used either to encode characters in the middle of input (with isEndOfInput=false) or to finalize the encoding process at the end of input (with isEndOfInput=true).

      Parameters:
      in - the CharBuffer containing characters to encode.
      isEndOfInput - if true, signals that no more input will be provided, allowing the encoder to complete its final encoding steps.
      Throws:
      CharacterCodingException

    • flushEncoder
